thread.title: Clinton Vows to 'Build' on Obama's Vision for America - Politics
thread.title_full: Clinton Vows to 'Build' on Obama's Vision for America - Politics - CBN News - Christian News 24-7 - CBN.com

author: CBNNews.com
title: Clinton Vows to 'Build' on Obama's Vision for America - Politics
text:
Hillary Clinton told Iowa Democrats she'll carry on with President Barack Obama's vision for America.
"I'm running as a proud Democrat," Clinton said. "We need to defend the progress we've made under President Obama and build on it until the recovery is secure."
The three remaining contenders for the Democratic nomination spoke to thousands of influential Democrats at a party fundraiser Saturday night.
Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders struck at Clinton's integrity, offering a list of issues in which she has waffled and he has stood on principle.
"I promise you tonight as your president, I will govern based on principle, not poll numbers," Sanders said.
Maryland Gov. Martin O'Malley also took a shot at Hillary, saying Democrats need to take firm positions and not shift with the political winds.
"We cannot move beyond today's gridlocked politics by returning to the divisions of our past," O'Malley said. "I'm not about that."
Clinton, still the front-runner, played it safe and mostly attacked Republicans who want to undo Obamacare and other unpopular policies.
"We're going to build an America...where a father can tell his daughter you can be anything you want to be, including president of the United States," she told the crowd to resounding cheers.
The next Democratic debate is Nov. 14.
